properties.event summary: 09/15/2011: On Thursday, at the checkpoint located at kilometer marker 30 on the Reynosa-Monterrey road, Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, Mexican Customs personnel arrested Feligonio Arias Suarez. Customs personnel also seized three .223 caliber AR-15 rifles, two 5.56 mm AR-15 rifles, one 7.62x39 mm AK-47 rifle, one .38 cal revolver, one 9mm pistol, one 40mm grenade launcher, twelve 9mm magazines, twenty .223 caliber magazines, twenty 7.62 mm magazines, three .223 caliber magazines, 505 .223 caliber rounds, four hundred 7.62x39 mm rounds, 258 9mm rounds, 88  .38 caliber rounds, 12 holsters,  four tactical vests, two tactical belts, one laser sight, four belt clips, one balaclava mask, two gun handguards, two LG cellular phones, and one Nextel Motorola radio. Authorities stopped a red Kenworth T600 truck with Federal Public Service license plates towing a white ThermoKing trailer at the checkpoint and conducted a search and seized the evidence.
properties.event title: One Man Arrested for Possession of Firearms in Tamaulipas, Mexico
properties.location: A man was arrested at the checkpoint located at kilometer marker 30 on the Reynosa-Monterrey road, Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/10/2011: On Monday, in the vicinity of Camargo, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel seized twenty six 7.62x39mm assault rifles, one 7.62 mm assault rifle, two .308 cal rounds, four .223 cal/ 5.56 mm carbines, two 9mm pistols, one .45 cal pistol, one Pietro Beretta .40 cal pistol, one .357 cal magnum revolver, one 40mm grenade launcher, 716 7.62x39 mm magazines, 121 5.56 mm magazines, four .380 cal magazines, five 9mm magazines, two .45 cal rifles, four fragmentation grenades, one hand grenade, eleven 40mm grenades, 16,940 7.62x39mm rounds, 3,435 .223 mm rounds, 747 .308 cal rounds,  fifty 9mm rounds, fifteen .45 cal rounds, 2,799 kilograms of marijuana. Military personnel were conducting patrols when they noticed an area where the land had been disturbed. Because of this, military personnel drove a rod into the dirt and the rod hit something metal.  The troops searched the area and found the items.
properties.event title: Military Personnel Seized Weapons, Magazines, Grenades and Marijuana
properties.location: The items were seized on a dirt road in Camargo, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/10/2011: On Monday, in the Colonias Villas del Roble, Las Haciendas and Chapultepec, Reynosa Municipality, Tamaulipas, Mexico, the Mexican Navy carried out operations and detained the following individuals: Victor Jimenez-Ramos alias Marrano, Mario E. Segura-Castillo, Jorge A. Gomez-Gomez, Ernest Vargas-Bonilla alias Neto, and Gabriela Gomez-Robles alias Gaby. Casrtillo was arrested for selling drugs and Gaby was the alleged accountant for the Gulf Cartel. The following items were also seized: 65 rifles, five handguns, 780 different caliber magazines, 3,000 ammunition belt links, 18,221 different caliber rounds of ammunition, two antitank grenades, four antipersonnel grenades, 251 hand grenades, 35 grenade launchers, ten grenade launching tubes, improvised explosive devices made up of galvanized tubes and cartons, one RPG, 324 RPG grenades, 57 pixilated uniforms, 19 head gear units, 47 VHF, communications equipment with 37 Chargers, 3 Items of solar panel equipment, 20 tactical belts, and several different types of vehicles. No casualties were reported.
properties.event title: Individuals Detained in Tamaulipas by Mexican Navy
properties.location: The operation occurred in Colonias Villas del Roble, Las Haciendas and Chapultepec, Reynosa Municipality, Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 11/03/2011: On Thursday, in a joint operation in five cities (Nuevo Laredo, Miguel Aleman, Reynosa, Rio Bravo, and Matamoros)  inTamaulipas, Mexico, the Secretariat of National Defense (SEDENA) through the Command of the IV Military Region,  the 8th Military Zone, and  military personnel with jurisdiction in different municipalities along the border of Tamaulipas seized drugs, weapons, ammunition, arrested ten individuals, and killed two individuals. Items seized were five tons 220 kilos of marijuana, 32 rifles, six handguns, 440 grams of cocaine, 320 grams of heroin, 12,915 rounds, 518 magazines, six grenades, three grenade launchers, and 13 vehicles (three were bullet proof vehicles). The article does not reveal any further information. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
properties.event title: Military Seized Evidence in Different Municipalities along Border of Tamaulipas
properties.location: The operations took place in Tamaulipas, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 11/22/2011: On Tuesday, in Los Guerra neighborhood, Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico, soldiers assigned to the 8th Military Zone, IV Military Region, located a building used as a weapons warehouse and seized 48 rifles, one rocket launcher, two grenade launchers, ten attachment grenades, eight fragmentation grenades, 1,165 magazines for different weapons, 37,900 different caliber cartridges, 15 two-way radios and several pieces tactical equipment. The warehouse was located during reconnaissance patrols. No group claimed responsibility for this incident. No casaulties were reported.
properties.event title: The Eight Military Zone Seized Arsenal from a Warehouse in Los Guerra Neighborhood
properties.location: The arsenal was seized in Los Guerra neighborhood, Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico.
